p: This study utilised SDM as a tool to assess general trends of climate change impacts on the current and future habitat distribution of T. robusta at both continental and regional scales, and to suggest potential conservation priority areas for the long term persistence of the species. Further refinement of the SDMs with integration of higher resolution topographically-downscaled climate data 57 and better representations of substrate variables 58, as well as species ecological dynamics 59 60 is necessary for better discrimination of future suitable habitat areas of T. robusta for predicting species long-term persistence under climate change, and confirm management recommendations.
